alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 4:36PM MST until August 08 at 6:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR LOCATIONS NORTH OF SEDONA IN COCONINO AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES... At 433 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain from thunderstorms has moved out of the warned area. However, flash flooding is still ongoing or expected to begin shortly as water drains. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Junipine Resort, Garland`s Oak Creek Lodge, Slide Rock State Park, West Fork Of Oak Creek, Cave Springs Campground and Manzanita Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 89A between mile markers 376 and 385. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Dry Creek, West Fork Oak Creek, Sycamore Creek, Spring Creek and Oak Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
